goals.question: What is the distribution of population across different countries?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of population by country
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the population distribution across different countries and identify the countries with the highest and lowest population.

goals.question: What is the relationship between GDP per capita and life expectancy?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of GDP per capita vs life expectancy
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between GDP per capita and life expectancy. It will also help us identify countries that are outliers in terms of life expectancy given their GDP per capita.

goals.question: What is the distribution of land area across different countries?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of land area by country
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the land area distribution across different countries and identify the countries with the largest and smallest land area.

goals.question: What is the distribution of population density across different countries?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the population density distribution across different countries and identify the countries with the highest and lowest population density.

goals.question: What is the relationship between literacy rate and GDP per capita?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of literacy rate vs GDP per capita
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between literacy rate and GDP per capita. It will also help us identify countries that are outliers in terms of literacy rate given their GDP per capita.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = data.plot(kind='bar', x='country', y='population')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title("What is the distribution of population across different countries?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['GDP per capita'], data['life expectancy'])
    plt.xlabel('GDP per capita')
    plt.ylabel('Life expectancy')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between GDP per capita and life expectancy?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    data.plot(kind='bar', x='country', y='land_area')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title("What is the distribution of land area across different countries?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    data['population_density'] = data['population'] / data['area']
    plt.hist(data['population_density'], bins=20, edgecolor='black')
    plt.xlabel('Population Density')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population density across different countries?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['literacy_rate'], data['gdp_per_capita'])
    plt.xlabel('Literacy Rate')
    plt.ylabel('GDP per Capita')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between literacy rate and GDP per capita?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
